description: From Middle English assailen, from Old French assaillir, assalir, from Late Latin assalīre, from Latin ad (“at, towards”) + salīre (“jump”). See also assault.

verbs.description: assail (third-person singular simple present assails, present participle assailing, simple past and past participle assailed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To attack with harsh words or violent force (also figuratively).
examples: Muggers assailed them as they entered an alley.
Our ears were assailed by her joyous efforts on her new saxophone.
